questions.question: What inputs text?
questions.explanation: Keyboard: text/command input device. Keys: represent characters, commands. Types: mechanical, membrane, wireless. Layouts: QWERTY standard. Benefits: familiar interface. Shortcuts: productivity boost. Ergonomic: reduce RSI (repetitive strain injury).

questions.question: What points on screen?
questions.explanation: Mouse: cursor control device. Movement: translate to cursor position. Clicking: select, activate. Scrolling: navigate documents. Types: wireless, mechanical, trackpad. Precision: selects small elements. Ergonomic: hand position important.

questions.question: What displays images?
questions.explanation: Monitor: visual output display. Resolution: pixel count determines clarity. Size: typically 20-40 inches. Refresh rate: 60-144+ Hz smoothness. Types: LCD, OLED, curved. Connections: HDMI, DisplayPort. Color: RGB or CMYK.

questions.question: What outputs sound?
questions.explanation: Speakers: sound output devices. Quality: depends on drivers, design. Wattage: power output level. Frequency: audio range (20Hz-20kHz). Connections: 3.5mm, USB, Bluetooth. Placement: affects audio quality. Headphones: personal audio alternative.

questions.question: What scans documents?
questions.explanation: Scanner: digitizes documents, photos. Resolution: measured DPI (dots per inch). Color: RGB scanning typical. Speed: pages per minute. Connectivity: USB typical. Output: PDF, JPEG formats. OCR: optical character recognition extracts text.

questions.question: What prints documents?
questions.explanation: Printer: outputs documents on paper. Types: inkjet, laser, thermal. Speed: pages per minute. Quality: measured DPI (dots per inch). Connectivity: USB, network. Consumables: ink, toner, paper. Maintenance: cartridge replacement.

questions.question: What captures images?
questions.explanation: Webcam: video capture device. Resolution: measured megapixels. Uses: video conferencing, streaming. Connectivity: USB typical. Autofocus: automatic focus adjustment. Microphone: often integrated. Privacy: security concern nowadays.

questions.question: What records sound?
questions.explanation: Microphone: sound capture device. Types: condenser, dynamic, lavalier. Sensitivity: measured dB. Uses: recording, video calls, podcasts. Connectivity: 3.5mm, USB, wireless. Quality: depends on design.

questions.question: What touches screens?
questions.explanation: Touchscreen: input via direct touching. Types: capacitive, resistive. Responsiveness: milliseconds lag. Multi-touch: multiple fingers simultaneously. Applications: tablets, phones, kiosks. Durability: repeated touching wear.

questions.question: What scans barcodes?
questions.explanation: Barcode scanner: reads encoded data. Types: laser, CCD, image-based. Data: encoded in bars/dots. Uses: retail, inventory, package tracking. Connectivity: USB, wireless. Speed: rapid scanning capability.
